title: Distinct Increasing Subsequences
text:
Given a sequence of N (1 ≤ N ≤ 10,000) integers S1... SN(0 ≤ Si< 1,000,000,000), compute the number of distinct increasing subsequences of S with length K (1 ≤ K ≤ 50 and K ≤ N).InputThe first line contains the two integers N and K. The following N lines contain the integers of the sequence in order.OutputPrint a single integer representing the number of distinct increasing subsequences of S of length K, modulo 5,000,000.ExampleInput:4 3
1
2
2
10Output:1The only increasing subsequence of length 3 is 1, 2, 10.
